author: Doug MacCash, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: John Pope signs his obituary opus 'Getting Off at Elysian Fields' this week
text:
Decades spent composing mini biographies of the recently departed on tight newspaper, uh, deadlines could make a person a bit fatalistic. But longtime obituary master John Pope managed to defeat any predictable grimness with a buoyant attitude and colorful bowties, as he celebrated (and celebrates) the incandescent lives of notable Crescent Cityites who have cast off this mortal coil.
John Pope (Photo courtesy John Pope) Pope, who is now a contributing writer at NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune, will sign copies of a recent collection of his elegantly eloquent obits "Getting Off at Elysian Fields : Obituaries from the New Orleans Times-Picayune" twice this week.
On Tuesday (Oct.13) at the Jefferson Parish Library, 4747 W. Napoleon Ave. in Metairie at 7 p.m.
And on Wednesday (Oct. 14) at Octavia Books, 513 Octavia St. at 6 p.m.
"Getting Off at Elysian Fields" is $30 in hardback.
Read Pope's recent obituary of superstar chef Paul Prudhomme.
